content.description: Start the same as for The Heart but do not use the good hold at head height.  After stemming up, more left to the steep slab and go straight up.  Really fun.

Might be the hardest slab at Lincoln Woods.  Climb the slab to the right of Heart of Glass following the left side of the slab.  Was originally done with a multiple pad stack, I think Dave Graham may have done it off of one pad.
content.location: Just right of Heart of Glass, #3 on the beta topo

content.description:
Start sitting at the base of The Scoop on decent edges (feet for The Scoop).  Move up and right across the start of The Scoop into the middle and upper moves of Heart of Glass.  

  An excellent (if infrequently done) linkup.
Looks easier than it is.  Start standing on two good crimps and work your way up into the scoop using the small pocket.
content.location: Just to the left of Heart of Glass, crimps are obvious and chalked and the pocket is apparent too.

content.description: Start sitting below the Scoop. Use the stand start footholds for your hands and fire up into the stand start.
content.protection: pads, watch out for the ankle-busting roots

content.description: Start on crimps around torso height, throw to jug, and top out. 1-move wonder but a fun one.
content.location: Just to the left of Heart Crack

content.description: Climb the smooth grooved face in the "crescent" shape of the heart topping out above a good jug
content.location: When looking at the heart boulder from the rd, this route lies in the "crescent" of the boulder that you see

content.description: Chris Smith was a hard working local who was always looking for the hardest way to do a problem. His traverse started on the protruding jug on the left side of the face and traversed a series of low holds with bad feet until the crack. At the crack, he continued up and right to an easy topout.
content.location: Back side (from the road) of the Heart boulder.

content.description: Start seated at the base of the problem "The heart". Choose your favorite hands and feet to press your way off the ground, until you can get in a standing position. Finish out on the route The Heart.
Sit start below the obvious arête.

This problem is fantastic, I have a hard time not throwing the pad down and getting on it every time I see it.  Be warned though, in the summer it feels nearly impossible. 

  Start with left hand on a sidepull rail and right hand on a sloper around the arete.  Put your left foot on a very small/slippery hold and heel hook the arete with your right.  Slap your way up the arete to the tough match and top out.  Some people start with the right hand on a high pinch too, but I find it easier and more fun to start on the low sloper. 

  V8 from the sit starting on a low crimp and sloper.
content.protection: 1 pad is fine, 2nd pad is nice if you come off up high.
content.location: You can see the backside of the arete from the road but it is basically on the side opposite of the road.  It faces the swamp.

content.description: Same start jug as "A Single Blade" - climb the super positive crack
content.location: Far left end of boulder, opposite "Heart of Glass" problem

content.description: Start on the protruding flake, traversing right until reaching the "Heart Crack" problem - topout for HC (V5 if you finish on "A Single Blade")
content.location: Furthest clockwise on the boulder from "Heart of Glass" - starts on the left end of the crack shared by "Heart Crack"

content.description:
SDS on the positive crack on the far right (same start jug as "A Single Blade"). Move up and match on a nice edge. Climb up to the lip and mantle the finish.

 Not sure if this line already has a name, let me know if so.
content.location: Far left end of boulder, opposite "Heart of Glass" problem.

content.description: Start on the same protruding flake as Chris's Traverse. Make one tall move straight up and top out.
content.location: On the corner between The Heart and Heart Crack.

content.description: Sit start on the large flake jug. Fire up to a crimp on the right side of the arete and climb the arete to its top with your right hand on the right side of the arete and your left on the left side.
content.location: About 15ft left of the "Heart of Glass" Problem. Obvious start jug

content.description: Home of the super classic Heart of Glass.  Pretty close to other good boulders and the warm up area.  One of the shorter walks from the main parking lot.
